data_table.description: Form 80 - Physical Measurements - resting pulse and blood pressure; height, weight; waist and hip circumference. This form was required for all OS participants.

variable.name: F80VY
variable.comment: Visit year for which this form was collected.

variable.name: HEIGHTX
variable.comment: Values at low and high ends of distribution are truncated.

variable.name: WEIGHTX
variable.comment: Values at low and high ends of distribution are truncated.

variable.name: WAISTX
variable.comment: Values at low and high ends of distribution are truncated.

variable.name: HIPX
variable.comment: Values at low and high ends of distribution are truncated.

variable.name: WHEXPECT
variable.comment: Flag indicating if Waist and Hip measurement collection is expected. Waist and Hip measurements are expected for all participants at baseline, at year 1 for CT, at year 3 for OS, and for a subsample of CT participants at years 3, 6, and 9.

variable.name: SYST
variable.comment: Computed from Form 80, questions 6.1 and 6.2. Systolic blood pressure: average of two baseline measurements. If only one measurement is known, the single value is used.

variable.name: SYSTOL
variable.comment: Computed from Form 80, questions 6.1 and 6.2. See SYST. Categorization of SYST into three groups: <= 120, >120-140 and > 140 .

variable.name: DIAS
variable.comment: Computed from Form 80, questions 6.1 and 6.2. Diastolic blood pressure: average of two baseline measurements. If only one measurement is known, the single value is used.

variable.name: DIASTOL
variable.comment: Computed from Form 80, questions 6.1 and 6.2. See DIAS. Categorization of DIAS into two groups: < 90 and >= 90 .

variable.name: BMIX
variable.comment: Computed from F80 Height cm and F80 Weight kg. If BMI is greater than 70 it is set to missing.

variable.name: BMICX
variable.comment: Computed from BMI. Reference: Expert Panel on the identification, evaluation, and treatment on overweight in adults (1998). Categorization of BMI into six groups. If a participant's BMI is greater than 70, BMICX is missing.

variable.name: WHRX
variable.comment: Ratio of F80 Waist circumference cm to F80 Hip circumference cm.
